definition: freedom of the media
medium/intermediary/matchmaker/go-between/abbr. for 媒體|媒体[mei2 ti3], media, esp. news media
body/form/style/system/substance/to experience/aspect (linguistics)
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
foolish talk/nonsense
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
lit. not eating for fear of choking (idiom); fig. to cut off one's nose to spite one's face/to avoid sth essential because of a slight risk
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
shouting abuse in the street like a fishwife
to act rashly/to act precipitously regardless of the consequences/reckless/foolhardy/daredevil
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities

definition: obscene language
defensive position/guard
to bow before (idiom)/to capitulate
